comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: why are you confused? these are all valid techniques for skipping or marking tests as pending. Are you suggesting that we may only use one way for marking test skip or pend/

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
We provide guidance in our documentation on how to skip tests. If we don't follow that guidance, there should be a good reason.

Also - consistency makes reviewing changes easier - when we deviate from a common pattern, it requires more effort to validate that the code is correct.

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: both try/finally and beforeall are allowed forms for skipping tests

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
Your guidelines suggest only one style: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/WritingPesterTests.md#skipping-tests-in-bulk

Barring other good technical reasons, I'd prefer consistency here.
